newsitem.title: USA: Grace to divest four non-core businesses. [CORRECTED 20:50 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Grace to divest four non-core businesses. [CORRECTED 20:50 GMT]

text.p: W.R. Grace & Co said Tuesday that it plans to divest four noncore businesses in the next three to six months in order to focus on its packaging and specialty chemicals businesses.

The divestitures should generate about $300 million in pre-tax proceeds, net of satisfaction of minority interest and other obligations associated with Grace Cocoa, Grace said (Corrects to add detail of other obligations.)
The businesses to be sold are Grace TEC Systems and Grace Specialty Polymers, Grace Cocoa and Amicon, previously classified as discontinued operations.

Grace TEC supplies dryers for the paper industry, Grace Cocoa produces and sells cocoa and chocolate, Amicon supplies biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies with molecular separation and purification products, and Grace Specialty Polymers supplies materials used in making circuit boards and components.
"We already have received interest from numerous parties for each of these businesses and, through the divestitures, we expect to generate greater value for Grace shareholders," the company stated.
The proceeds will be invested in packaging and speciality chemicals divisions and continue a previously announced share buyback program, the company said.
The company also said it would continue to seek additional acquisitions and investments in its core businesses.
